title: FirstFT: China sets 5% economic expansion goal
description: Also in today’s newsletter, Iran agrees to install cameras at nuclear sites, and Michelle Yeoh for Lunch with the FT

title: Unite calls off ambulance strikes and agrees to government pay talks
description: Union had planned strike action on Monday and Wednesday across seven trusts

title: Fire Brigades Union backs collective bargaining
description: FBU chief rejects proposals to bring in the pay review bodies involved in more intractable public-sector disputes

title: ECB must do more to tackle inflation ‘monster’, says Lagarde
description: Central bank not seeking to ‘break economy’ but price pressures remain sticky, warns president

title: Let’s talk
description: UK and French leaders meet, Turkey talks Nato with Finland and Sweden, and NHS employers hold pay talks with unions

title: Moderate Republican Hogan says he will not challenge Trump in 2024
description: Former governor of Maryland wants to avoid a ‘pile-up’ that would aid the ex-president’s nomination

title: Kroll and Jones Day accused of conspiracy to protect Wirecard
description: Short seller claims ‘campaign of harassment’ aimed to deter him from reporting on now collapsed German group

title: Inflation hits UK’s pledge to build 40 new hospitals
description: Officials debate which projects to freeze with NHS capital budget now facing a £2bn shortfall

title: Spain plans to introduce cabinet gender equality law
description: Prime minister’s measures will make the country one of the first in Europe to have a legally binding quota

title: Sunak to introduce new laws to stem cross-Channel migration
description: People arriving in UK by small boat will be barred from claiming asylum under new bill

title: Meloni defends Italy’s response to deadly migrant shipwreck
description: Italian leader faces mounting pressure after critics blame hardline policies for deaths of more than 70 people

title: Britain must leave the Energy Charter Treaty
description: Withdrawal from the outdated agreement is a test of the UK’s climate leadership and seriousness about getting to net zero

title: UN high seas treaty to protect oceans finally agreed
description: Heated talks conclude with accord that aims to keep safe 30% of international waters by 2030

title: Muddled engagement with China leaves Xinjiang in the lurch
description: Toothless sanctions and empty agreements with Beijing fail to improve human rights in the region

title: Is the US jobs market still booming?
description: Market Questions is the FT’s guide to the week ahead

title: The UK economy has two regional problems, not one
description: Now the country is suffering something worse than geographic inequality: national stagnation

title: The US Chips Act becomes a Christmas tree
description: The White House is using a national security priority to tackle too many goals

title: Iran agrees to reinstall IAEA cameras at nuclear facilities
description: UN atomic watchdog gains agreement to restart monitoring after visit to Islamic republic

title: Global commodity trading earnings reach record $115bn
description: Independent houses benefit most from soaring profits driven by Ukraine war

title: European industrialists question focus of energy subsidies
description: Policies should concentrate on reducing fossil fuel demand and transition to renewables, say top executives

title: China’s military budget outpaces economic growth in shift to security
description: Defence expenditure to rise by 7.2 per cent in 2023 compared with 5 per cent target for GDP

title: British public U-turn on attitudes to immigration
description: Other charts of the week: Antarctic sea ice, gender inequality among decision makers, economy concern

title: How Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro outfoxed the west
description: The repressive leader has weathered an economic crisis, sanctions and an uprising. What should the US do with him now?

title: International schools shift to new markets after China boom stalls
description: Countries such as India, Nigeria and Japan lure global education providers and prestigious UK institutions

title: Nigeria’s new president inherits fragile nation
description: Youthful west African country with dysfunctional economy presents vast challenges for winner of closely-run vote

title: UK and Australia urge Washington to ease secrecy rules in security pact
description: Allies fear an unwillingness to share sensitive information and technology could hamper Aukus

title: Upland farmers lose hope for Brexit dividend
description: Leaving the Common Agricultural Policy was meant to herald a new era

title: China sets 5 per cent growth target to drive economic recovery
description: National People’s Congress opens with president Xi Jinping planning sweeping changes to centralise power further

title: Chinese regulators probe large Covid-related writedowns
description: Property developers have led in making provisions, even though home sales are starting to recover

title: The politics of deglobalisation favours the robots
description: As labour supply problems persist, automation sales are hotting up
